content: noro fan scarf by susan ashcroft yarn sock sport dk worsted or aran weight designed for noro yarn - you get extra complexity for no extra effort allow approx 300 400m 330 440 yds the ito scarf shown below was made with a single skein 400m and is 180 x 27cm 11 x 70 the silk garden sock version on the left was made with a single skein 300m and is 8 x 72 20 x 183cm needle size and gauge you don t need to knit to a specific gauge just be sure you like the fabric you are creating suggestions for average gauge sock/fingerng with 4mm/us 6 dk with 4 5mm/us7 jchan8 - noro silk garden sock on 4mm/us 6 40sts worsted with 5mm/us8 aran with 5 5mm/us9 you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the pattern page on ravelry link abbreviations/stitches used k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es yo = yarnover k2tog = knit 2 sts together rs/ws = right side/wrong side noro ito on 5mm/us 8 52 sts © ashcroft-hempsall 2010 + 2021 - for personal non-commercial use only noro fan scarf 2 no need to swatch because you only begin with a small number of stitches you may as well just start but if you are not sure about the fabric then restart with a different needle size separately so that you can compare the two pieces and decide which to continue with making the scarf cast on 40 or 52 sts or other multiple of 12 +4 using cable cast-on - link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html border knit 4 row garter stitch main repeat r1 rs k2 k2tog x2 * yo k1 x 4 k2tog x4 repeat from * to last 10 sts yo k1 x4 k2tog x2 k2 r2 + r4 k2 purl to last 2 sts k2 r3 knit all sts repeat r1-r4 until you have the desired length or until you like the colours reserving enough yarn for at least 4 row of garter stitch and stopping after r1 in the one shown below i stopped a little earlier then strictuly necessary so that i would finish on the purples rather than the orange 2nd border knit 3 row and then bind off knitwise on the ws using lifted bind-off worked firmly and evenly no stretch needed weave in the ends block - straightening the sides and pulling out the ends to form curves pin slightly in from the edge to get curves instead of points note the ends will be different one will have one extra curve it s easy to form straight lines in the scarf if you block on a towel with lines or a waffle grid pattern © ashcroft-hempsall 2010 + 2021 -
